Body: I have an extra Android device (a mobile phone, Samsung Galaxy Y Duos, S6102B, Android 2.3.6 - rooted), that I call D1 here, and would like to use it as my "car brain", like a low-cost multimedia central, to do a lot of things.On this question, I would like to know:If I have another Android device, called here D2;How to play every sound from D2 on D1 using bluetooth connection.Example:I'm on a call on D2. When I enter the car and turn D1 on, when D1 and D2 become bluetooth-paired, I can drive and continue talking via D1 (like a handsfree device), with D2 on my pocket;I'm hearing music on D2 with my headphones. When I enter the car and turn D1 on, when D1 and D2 become bluetooth-paired, I can hear the music from D2.
Title: How to use one Android phone as a handsfree device to another (via Bluetooth)?

history.Text: I have an extra Android device (a mobile phone, Samsung Galaxy Y Duos, S6102B, Android 2.3.6 - rooted), that I call D1 here, and would like to use it as my "car brain", like a low-cost multimedia central, to do a lot of things.On this question, I would like to know:* If I have another Android device, called here D2;* How to play every sound from D2 on D1 using bluetooth or wi-fi connections.Example:1. I'm on a call on D2. When I enter the car and turn D1 on, when D1 and D2 become bluetooth-paired or when routed wi-fi from D2 is connected on D1, I can drive and continue talking via D1 (like a handsfree device), with D2 on my pocket;2. I'm hearing music on D2 with my headphones. When I enter the car and turn D1 on, when D1 and D2 become bluetooth-paired or when routed wi-fi from D2 is connected on D1, I can hear the music from D2.
How to use one Android phone as a handsfree device to another?

history.Comment: This issue was closed because another about bluetooth connection is similar, but this question was for BT and WI-FI solutions (i.e., it was partially duplicate). So I change it to BT only, to fit the "duplicate" flag, and I will open another for WI-FI only.

I'm on a call on D2. When I enter the car and turn D1 on, when D1 and D2 become bluetooth-paired, I can drive and continue talking via D1 (like a handsfree device), with D2 on my pocket;2. I'm hearing music on D2 with my headphones. When I enter the car and turn D1 on, when D1 and D2 become bluetooth-paired, I can hear the music from D2.
